summary: Lymphangiosarcoma is a rare cancer that occurs in long-standing cases of primary or secondary lymphedema, typically affecting the extremities. It is believed to arise from endothelial cells and may be more accurately referred to as angiosarcoma. It metastasizes quickly.
causes: Lymphedema (swelling due to lymphatic system obstruction)
risk_factors: Survival of five or more years post-mastectomy
symptoms: Tender skin nodule in the extremity
Extensive necrotic focus involving skin and subcutaneous tissue
